message.content:
cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.HC, cs.SI, cs.CL 

This paper is likely to belong to the Information Retrieval (cs.IR) sub-category as it discusses the evaluation of recommender systems, which are commonly used in information retrieval applications. It could also belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-category as recommender systems often use machine learning algorithms. The Human-Computer Interaction (cs.HC) sub-category is also a possibility as the paper discusses how to present evaluation metrics in a more meaningful way for users. The Social and Information Networks (cs.SI) sub-category is relevant as recommender systems often rely on social network data. Finally, the Computation and Language (cs.CL) sub-category could be relevant as natural language processing techniques are often used in recommender systems.
